Evil, it was all around him and so was it's awful stench.  Tucson did as in=
structed but there was no way in the name of Primus that he was going to bo=
w to Magmatron.  He snaps his tail and gives a thunderous roar, that sounds=
 very much like the thunder of the heavens.  He swings his draconic head up=
 while staring firmly at Magmatron.

" I will not kneel to Evil!  And nothi=
ng you do to me will make me change my mind!"

He slams his right front foo=
t down hard as clawed talons scrape at the floor.

" Torture me all you wan=
t, I will NEVER SURRENDER TO THE LIKES OF YOU!"

Perpetually on the move an=
d constantly busy. 

On Sep 18, 2011, at 4:54 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercycl=
onus@...> wrote:

> The room that TUSCON was led into was moderately =
large to say the least. The ceiling was perhaps ten to fifteen feet above T=
USCON=E2=80=99s head and was perhaps thirty five to forty feet wide; the ro=
om itself was large enough to accommodate the largest of most transfomers. =
The walls and ceiling appeared to be made out of some sort of hyper dense p=
urple hued metal that looked it could withstand a full hit from GRIMLOCK wi=
thout even a dent. There were no windows in this room, although there were =
other doors, all of them closed at the moment.
> 
>  
> 
> The motif oft th=
e chamber was a cross between a ship=E2=80=99s bridge and perhaps a medieva=
l throne room. Computer consoles lined the walls with small view screens po=
sitioned above them. Against one of the far wall a huge view screen dominat=
ed nearly the entire wall and on it were depicted different scenes and cham=
bers that TUSCON himself was unfamiliar with. However judging by the simila=
rities of motif, it might be safe to conclude that they were other places w=
ithin the same structure that TUSCON was now in.
> 
>  
> 
> In the center =
of the room hanging from the ceiling was glowing sphere that glowed a stran=
ge combination of swirling black and purple, energy arcing along its surfac=
e. It was about the size of a basket ball =E2=80=93 if basketballs existed =
at this point in human development - and was attached next to the ceiling b=
y a short metal pole. Directly below this was what would pass for a throne =
or perhaps a captain=E2=80=99s chair that sat up on a raised dais of some s=
ort, a few stairs leading down to the floor level that TUSCON himself now s=
tood. On this chair a massive figure was seated, his size and power evident=
 even though the figure on it was seated and faced away from TUSCON.
> 
>  =

> 
> As TUSCON entered into the room the figure turned his chair to face h=
im and then stood, it was obvious that he was head and shoulders larger tha=
n TUSCON himself. This figure looked almost muscular the way his armor was =
set on his frame. He looked to be fully as large as OPTIMAL OPTIMUS or as l=
arge as HYDRAS!
> 
>  
> 
> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/nbwrpg/photos/alb=
um/306782857/pic/706257948/view
> 
>  
> 
> At his side stood a comparative=
ly smaller figure who was perhaps seven or eight feet or so, standing maybe=
 as tall as CHEETOR or some of the other Maximals, however his presence is =
still powerful and clearly felt. He was predominantly silver with purple ar=
mor at his shins and chest. He had wing like protrusions on his back and hi=
s cranial armor looked almost like an Incan chieftain's headdress.
> 
>  
>=
 
> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/nbwrpg/photos/album/306782857/pic/1016482=
216/view
> 
>  
> 
> GUILEDART stepped forward and bowed down at the foot o=
f the stairs, seemingly not even willing to step on the same stair as the o=
nes above.
> 
>  
> 
> =E2=80=9CGreat Magamtron and Lord Saberback.=E2=80=
=9D GUILDART said from his kneeling position. =E2=80=9CWe have brought this=
 one to you for your pleasure.=E2=80=9D His tone was one of humility, as a =
servant before his lord.
> 
>  
> 
> The large figure on, MAGMATRON looked =
down at TUSCON, his large size made to appear even larger as he was standin=
g on that raised dais. =E2=80=9CAhh yes. I have had a chance to view your f=
ighting prowess.=E2=80=9D He said with a sardonic smile. =E2=80=9CYou amuse=
 me, I think you will do well.=E2=80=9D He smiled as he stroked his chin, h=
is gaze on TUSCON watchful and thoughtful, like a chess master watching a n=
ew but inferior opponent.
> 
>  
> 
> HARDHEAD and HYDRA said to TUSCON =E2=
=80=9CKneel before Magmatron!=E2=80=9D their weapons pointed directly at TU=
SCON=E2=80=99s back!
> 
>  
> 
> (TAG)
> 
>  
> 
> Preston
> 
>  
> 
>  
> =

> 

--Apple-Mail-20-926400154

<html><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Evil, it was all around him and so was=
 it's awful stench.  Tucson did as instructed but there was no way in =
the name of Primus that he was going to bow to Magmatron.  He snaps hi=
s tail and gives a thunderous roar, that sounds very much like the thunder =
of the heavens.  He swings his draconic head up while staring firmly a=
t Magmatron.</div><div><br></div><div>" I will not kneel to Evil!  And=
 nothing you do to me will make me change my mind!"</div><div><br></div><di=
v>He slams his right front foot down hard as clawed talons scrape at the fl=
oor.</div><div><br></div><div>" Torture me all you want, I will NEVER SURRE=
NDER TO THE LIKES OF YOU!"</div><div><br>Perpetually on the move and consta=
ntly busy. </div><div><br>On Sep 18, 2011, at 4:54 PM, Super Cyclonus =
<<a href=3D"mailto:supercyclonus@...">supercyclonus@...</a>&=
gt; wrote:<br><br></div><div></div><blockquote type=3D"cite"><div>

n style=3D"display:none"> </span>

      <p></p><div><font face=3D"courier new,monospace">
<p class=3D=
"MsoNormal"><span style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Courier New';FONT-SIZE: 10pt;">The=
 room that TUSCON was led into was moderately large to say the least. The c=
eiling was perhaps ten to fifteen feet above TUSCON=E2=80=99s head and was =
perhaps thirty five to forty feet wide; the room itself was large enough to=
 accommodate the largest of most transfomers. The walls and ceiling appeare=
d to be made out of some sort of hyper dense purple hued metal that looked =
it could withstand a full hit from GRIMLOCK without even a dent. There were=
 no windows in this room, although there were other doors, all of them clos=
ed at the moment. </span></p>

<p class=3D"MsoNormal"><span style=3D"FONT-F=
AMILY: 'Courier New';FONT-SIZE: 10pt;"> </span></p>
<p class=3D"MsoNor=
mal"><span style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Courier New';FONT-SIZE: 10pt;">The motif =
oft the chamber was a cross between a ship=E2=80=99s bridge and perhaps a m=
edieval throne room. Computer consoles lined the walls with small view scre=
ens positioned above them. Against one of the far wall a huge view screen d=
ominated nearly the entire wall and on it were depicted different scenes an=
d chambers that TUSCON himself was unfamiliar with. However judging by the =
similarities of motif, it might be safe to conclude that they were other pl=
aces within the same structure that TUSCON was now in. </span></p>

<p clas=
s=3D"MsoNormal"><span style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Courier New';FONT-SIZE: 10pt;"=
> </span></p>
<p class=3D"MsoNormal"><span style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Cour=
ier New';FONT-SIZE: 10pt;">In the center of the room hanging from the ceili=
ng was glowing sphere that glowed a strange combination of swirling black a=
nd purple, energy arcing along its surface. It was about the size of a bask=
et ball =E2=80=93 if basketballs existed at this point in human development=
 - and was attached next to the ceiling by a short metal pole. Directly bel=
ow this was what would pass for a throne or perhaps a captain=E2=80=99s cha=
ir that sat up on a raised dais of some sort, a few stairs leading down to =
the floor level that TUSCON himself now stood. On this chair a massive figu=
re was seated, his size and power evident even though the figure on it was =
seated and faced away from TUSCON. </span></p>

<p class=3D"MsoNormal"><spa=
n style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Courier New';FONT-SIZE: 10pt;"> </span></p>
<=
p class=3D"MsoNormal"><span style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Courier New';FONT-SIZE: =
10pt;">As TUSCON entered into the room the figure turned his chair to face =
him and then stood, it was obvious that he was head and shoulders larger th=
an TUSCON himself. This figure looked almost muscular the way his armor was=
 set on his frame. He looked to be fully as large as OPTIMAL OPTIMUS or as =
large as HYDRAS!</span></p>

<p class=3D"MsoNormal"><span style=3D"FONT-FAM=
ILY: 'Courier New';FONT-SIZE: 10pt;"> </span></p>
<p class=3D"MsoNorma=
l"><span style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Courier New';FONT-SIZE: 10pt;"><a href=3D"h=
ttp://groups.yahoo.com/group/nbwrpg/photos/album/306782857/pic/706257948/vi=
ew"><font color=3D"#800080">http://groups.yahoo.com/group/nbwrpg/photos/alb=
um/306782857/pic/706257948/view</font></a></span></p>

<p class=3D"MsoNorma=
l"><span style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Courier New';FONT-SIZE: 10pt;"> </span=
></p>
<p class=3D"MsoNormal"><span style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Courier New';FONT=
-SIZE: 10pt;">At his side stood a comparatively smaller figure who was perh=
aps seven or eight feet or so, standing maybe as tall as CHEETOR or some of=
 the other Maximals, however his presence is still powerful and clearly fel=
t. He was predominantly silver with purple armor at his shins and chest. He=
 had wing like protrusions on his back and his cranial armor looked almost =
like an Incan chieftain's headdress.</span></p>

<p class=3D"MsoNormal"><sp=
an style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Courier New';FONT-SIZE: 10pt;"> </span></p>
=
<p class=3D"MsoNormal"><span style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Courier New';FONT-SIZE:=
 10pt;"><a href=3D"http://groups.yahoo.com/group/nbwrpg/photos/album/306782=

oup/nbwrpg/photos/album/306782857/pic/1016482216/view</font></a></span></p>=


<p class=3D"MsoNormal"><span style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Courier New';FONT-SIZ=
E: 10pt;"> </span></p>
<p class=3D"MsoNormal"><span style=3D"FONT-FAMI=
LY: 'Courier New';FONT-SIZE: 10pt;">GUILEDART stepped forward and bowed dow=
n at the foot of the stairs, seemingly not even willing to step on the same=
 stair as the ones above. </span></p>

<p class=3D"MsoNormal"><span style=
=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Courier New';FONT-SIZE: 10pt;"> </span></p>
<p class=
=3D"MsoNormal"><span style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Courier New';FONT-SIZE: 10pt;">=
=E2=80=9CGreat Magamtron and Lord Saberback.=E2=80=9D GUILDART said from hi=
s kneeling position. =E2=80=9CWe have brought this one to you for your plea=
sure.=E2=80=9D His tone was one of humility, as a servant before his lord. =
</span></p>

<p class=3D"MsoNormal"><span style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Courier Ne=
w';FONT-SIZE: 10pt;"> </span></p>
<p class=3D"MsoNormal"><span style=
=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Courier New';FONT-SIZE: 10pt;">The large figure on, MAGMA=
TRON looked down at TUSCON, his large size made to appear even larger as he=
 was standing on that raised dais. =E2=80=9CAhh yes. I have had a chance to=
 view your fighting prowess.=E2=80=9D He said with a sardonic smile. =E2=80=
=9CYou amuse me, I think you will do well.=E2=80=9D He smiled as he stroked=
 his chin, his gaze on TUSCON watchful and thoughtful, like a chess master =
watching a new but inferior opponent.</span></p>

<p class=3D"MsoNormal"><s=
pan style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Courier New';FONT-SIZE: 10pt;"> </span></p>=

<p class=3D"MsoNormal"><span style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Courier New';FONT-SIZE=
: 10pt;">HARDHEAD and HYDRA said to TUSCON =E2=80=9CKneel before Magmatron!=
=E2=80=9D their weapons pointed directly at TUSCON=E2=80=99s back!</span></=
p>

<p class=3D"MsoNormal"><span style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: 'Courier New';FONT-S=
